replies.author: nielsdraaisma

replies.bodyText: Having had another look at this, it's probably safe to roll out as is, each subscription has it's own orderbook which get updated for subscription. Although it's not the most efficient way when multiple subscriptions are present, that seems to be a common way of implementing this in various other streaming exchanges.
replies.author: nielsdraaisma

replies.author: earce

timeline.bodyText:
I don't this is is the right way to set this up because if you have disconnect and reconnect this will publish a message for every reconnect you have had during the course of your application. So if you disconnect 2 times and reconnect a 3rd this will publish your message 3 times a second when you reconnect.
You can test this by breaking internet connection deliberately and seeing how many time the message gets published. Something like (with your parameters and ping message):
    Observable.interval(1, TimeUnit.SECONDS) .subscribe( t -> { if (isSocketOpen()) webSocketChannel.writeAndFlush(new PingWebSocketFrame()); });
Should accomplish what you want
timeline.author: earce
